Source code¶

Source code is split into 3 files.

Logger¶

Logger class definition used in whole class.

class pps.logger.Logger(logger_name)¶

Bases: object

Class used for logging. It uses standard python logging module. All logs are stored to file set in config. Format of is also set in config.

critical(message)¶

Log message with critical priority. :param message: str message to write to log

debug(message: str)¶

Log message with debug priority. :param message: str message to write to log

error(message)¶

Log message with error priority. :param message: str message to write to log

info(message: str)¶

Log message with info priority. :param message: str message to write to log

warning(message)¶

Log message with warning priority. :param message: str message to write to log

Logic¶

This file defines all operations with printer jobs.

pps.logic.add_to_print_queue(file: str, directory_path: str, printer: str, my_logger: pps.logger.Logger) → str¶

Add job to print queue and return print job id. If any error occurs return value of UNKNOWN_PRINT_JOB_ID in config. :param file: str file name :param directory_path: str path to directory of file. :param printer: str name of installed printer in CUPS server. :param my_logger: Logger class for logging. :return: str job id or UNKNOWN_PRINT_JOB_ID in config.

pps.logic.get_file_format(directory_path: str, file: str, my_logger: pps.logger.Logger) → str¶

Get file format from print file. Firstly create temporary pdf document with ghostpcl, then use pdfinfo and get page count. :param directory_path: str path to directory of file. :param file: str file name. :param my_logger: Logger class for logging. :return: str paper format or value of UNKNOWN_PAPER_FORMAT from config if any error occurs.

pps.logic.get_format_from_size(a: float, b: float) → str¶

Return file format from size in pixels. Return unknown paper format if nothing is matched. :param a: float smaller size of document :param b: float bigger size of document :return: str file format

pps.logic.get_number_of_pages(full_path_name: str, my_logger: pps.logger.Logger) → str¶

Get number of pages. This function uses pkpgcounter bash command to count pages. :param full_path_name: str absolute path to file. :param my_logger: Logger class for logging. :return: str number of pages or value of UNKNOWN_PAGE_COUNT from config.

pps.logic.get_print_job_id(file_name: str, my_logger: pps.logger.Logger) → str¶

Get print job id from print queue. This function uses bash lpq. :param file_name: str name of file to search for in print queue. :param my_logger: Logger class for logging. :return: str print job id or value of UNKNOWN_PRINT_JOB_ID from config.

pps.logic.get_print_job_name(full_path_name: str, my_logger: pps.logger.Logger) → str¶

Get print job name from file in PCL6 format. :param full_path_name: str absolute path to file. :param my_logger: Logger class for logging. :return: str print job name or value of UNKNOWN_PRINT_JOB_NAME from config.

pps.logic.handle_enqueue(my_logger: pps.logger.Logger, file: str, ip: str, printer: str, date: str, username: str, directory_path: str, full_file_path: str)¶

Handle enqueue process. Get all info about print job and add it to queue. Then send info to server for acknowledgement. :param my_logger: Logger class for logging. :param file: str file name :param ip: str ip address of client that has sent print job :param printer: str name of virtual printer that received print job :param date: str datetime of print job :param username: str name of user that has sent print job :param directory_path: str path to directory of file. :param full_file_path: str absolute path to file that should be sent to printer :return:

pps.logic.is_printer_online(my_logger: pps.logger.Logger) → bool¶

Check if printer is online. This function simple load printer administration page. :param my_logger: Logger class for logging. :return: bool True if print is online.

pps.logic.main()¶
pps.logic.remove_file(full_file_path: str, my_logger: pps.logger.Logger)¶

Delete file from disk. :param full_file_path: str absolute path to file that should be sent to printer :param my_logger: Logger class for logging. :return: nothing

pps.logic.resume_job(print_job_id: str, my_logger: pps.logger.Logger) → bool¶

Resume job that is in print queue. This function uses lp command. :param print_job_id: str id of print job to resume :param my_logger: Logger class for logging. :return: True if lp command return 0.

pps.logic.send_to_real_printer(full_file_name: str, printer: str, my_logger: pps.logger.Logger)¶

Send job to real printer given as argument. This function uses lpr to send job to printer. :param full_file_name: str absolute path to file that should be sent to printer :param printer: str name of installed printer in CUPS server. :param my_logger: Logger class for logging. :return: nothing

Server¶

This file contains Flask server definition. It handles all actions from user.

class pps.server.Server¶

Bases: object

Server class used to store jobs dictionary and logger.

add_job(key, job)¶
del_job(job_id)¶
get_jobs() → dict¶
get_logger() → pps.logger.Logger¶
set_job_status(job_id, status)¶
pps.server.add_new_job()¶

Add new job to print queue. :return: 200 in case of success, 400 in case job wasn’t added.

pps.server.create_app(*args, **kwargs)¶

Create flask app with predefined values. :return: Flask application

pps.server.do_login()¶

Login user with values from form as username as password. Then search for user in database. :return: Redirects to home page.

pps.server.do_logout()¶

Logout currently signed in user. :return: redirects to home page

pps.server.hide_row()¶

Remove job from jobs dict based on job_id. :return: 200 in case of success removal, 400 otherwise.

pps.server.home()¶

Render template with actual jobs. :return: HTML page.

pps.server.logged_id(session) → bool¶

Check if user is logged_in based on session cookie :param session: :return: bool True if user is logged in, False otherwise.

pps.server.login()¶

Render template with actual jobs. :return: HTML page.

pps.server.resume_print()¶

Resume held job in print queue. :return: 200 in case of success otherwise 400
